metadata.name: Sharik #1: Not Every Dog is Created Equal
metadata.description:
Artwork by Hulki Okan Tabak, 30 Editions, Minted on Heart of a Dog smart contract, 2022

Sharik is an experimental homage to the writer Mikhail Bulgaov. In the novella Heart of a Dog, Sharik is the street dog operated on by the Professor.

Heart of a Dog has been interpreted both as a satire on Bolshevism and as a criticism of eugenics. One commonly accepted interpretation is that Bulgakov was trying to show all the inconsistencies of the system in which Sharikov, a man with a dog's intelligence, could become an important part. Sharik is seen as "a reincarnation of the repellent proletarian", and the professor represents a "hyperbolic vision of the bourgeois dream", according to J. A. E. Curtis. (wikipedia)
